thread.title: Sun TV Q1 net profit surges 19.10% to Rs 197 cr
thread.title_full: Sun TV Q1 net profit surges 19.10% to Rs 197 cr | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: Sun TV Q1 net profit surges 19.10% to Rs 197 cr
text:
Other Articles Allcargo Logistics Expands its Senior Leadership Team Aptech Steps into the BFSI Segment with its Banking & Finance Academy Larsen & Toubro to sell 15% stake in IT unit IPO; may raise Rs 2,500 cr Sun TV on Friday reported a 19.10 per cent increase in net profit at Rs 197.28 crore for the first quarter ended June 30, 2015.
The company had reported a net profit of Rs 165.64 crore for the April-June quarter of the last year.
Income from operations of the Kalanidhi Maran-owned Sun TV Network in the quarter under review increased by 9.07 per cent to Rs 691.09 crore as against Rs 633.58 crore in the corresponding quarter last year, the company said in a BSE filing.
During the quarter, Sun TVâ€™s advertising revenue increased by 16 per cent to Rs 323.89 crore.
Its subscription revenue grew by 13 per cent while its direct-to-home (DTH) subscription revenue increased by 9 per cent over the same period a year ago.
Shares of the Chennai-based television broadcaster were trading at Rs 333.35 per scrip in the afternoon trade, up 7.90 per cent from the previous close on BSE.
First Published on July 31, 2015 2:14 pm
